messages.content: ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes is a collection of custom nodes for ComfyUI, a GUI that uses stable diffusion model to generate images and videos.

To install ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes, first install ComfyUI, then git clone the repository in the 'custom_nodes' folder inside your ComfyUI installation or download as zip and unzip the contents to 'custom_nodes/ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes'. Finally, start or restart ComfyUI.
What is the Pixel Sort node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes?
The Pixel Sort node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes is a pixel sorting effect by satyarth. It installs the pixelsort module upon installation.
What is the Swap Color Mode (Black & White) node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes?

The Swap Color Mode (Black & White) node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes swaps the color mode to luminescence or single channel, useful for making masks or simply making stuff black and white. It is also useful when changing RGB modes.
What is the Solid Color node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes?
The Solid Color node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes generates an empty solid color image with options for color, size, and batch size.
What is the Glitch This node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes?
The Glitch This node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes adds the Glitch This! effect to images.
What is the Add Text To Image node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes?
The Add Text To Image node in ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes allows you to supply the path to a .ttf file and add text to an image input. It has options for anchor placement, rotation, color, and more.
